pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Thursday, July 8, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Coquitlam, British Columbia

Private meetings.

8:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will convene a meeting of the Incident Response Group to discuss the wildfires and extreme weather impacts in Western Canada.

Closed to media.

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will make an early learning and child care announcement along with Premier of British Columbia John Horgan, Minister of Families, Children and Social Development Ahmed Hussen, Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Disability Inclusion Carla Qualtrough, and Member of Parliament for Coquitlam—Port Coquitlam Ron McKinnon. A media availability will follow.

Coquitlam City Hall
3000 Guildford Way

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media will check in at Coquitlam City Hall, outside of the main entrance.
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 9:00 a.m.
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Toll-free: 1-888-892-3255
    Pass code: 587888

12:35 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Premier of British Columbia, John Horgan.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

1:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with Mayor of Lytton Jan Polderman, Chief of Lytton First Nation Janet Webster, and Chair of the Nlaka’pamux Nation Tribal Council Chief Matt Pasco.

Closed to media.
